title: Fact-Checking
This list covers a range of perspectives on disinformation, from academic research to journalistic practice
**"The Spread of True and False News Online"** by Hunt Allcott and Matthew Gentzkow
- Examines the spread of false news on social media and its impact on public opinion
**"The Psychology of Fake News"** by Sander van der Linden
- Explores the psychological factors that contribute to the spread of fake news
- A comprehensive overview of propaganda techniques and their historical use
- Reviews various methods for detecting media bias in news articles

author.particle: The Impact of Fake News on Social Media" by

title: - Analyzes the impact of fake news on social media platforms
**"The Role of Social Media in the Spread of Fake News"** by
- Investigates the role of social media in the spread of fake news
- Discusses the challenges posed by fake news to journalism and the future of news consumption
**"Fact-Checking in the Digital Age"** by Craig Silverman
- Explores the challenges and opportunities of fact-checking in the digital age
**"The Rise of Fake News and the Fall of Trust"** by David Roberts
note: - Examines the impact of fake news on public trust in media.

title: **"How to Spot Fake News"** by The Associated Press (2017) - Provides practical tips for identifying fake news
**"The Fake News Problem: How to Spot It and What to Do About It"** by The New York Times
- Offers a comprehensive guide to understanding and combating fake news
**"The Truth About Fake News"** by The Washington Post (2017) - Explores the origins and spread of fake news
**"The Fake News Epidemic"** by The Guardian
- Examines the impact of fake news on society
**Policy and Regulation:**
**"Combating Fake News: A Global Perspective"** by The United Nations
- Provides a global overview of efforts to combat fake news
**"Fake News and the Future of Democracy"** by The European Union
- Examines the threat posed by fake news to democracy
**"The Role of Government in Combating Fake News"** by The Brookings Institution
- Discusses the role of government in combating fake news
- A critical analysis of media bias and its role in shaping public opinion
**"Manufacturing Consent: The Political Economy of the Mass Media"** by Noam Chomsky (1988) - A classic work on the relationship between media and power
**"The Age of Propaganda: The Everyday Use and Abuse of Persuasion"** by Jason Stanley
- Explores the use of propaganda in contemporary society
**"The Filter Bubble: What the Internet Is Hiding from You"** by Eli Pariser
- Examines the phenomenon of filter bubbles and their impact on information consumption

**Note:** This list is not exhaustive and there are many other valuable resources available on this topic. It is important to consult a variety of sources to gain a comprehensive understanding of disinformation and its impact
